definition: capacity/quantity/amount/to estimate/abbr. for 量詞|量词[liang4 ci2], classifier (in Chinese grammar)/measure word

sentences.english: Those small exposures add up and may contribute to later-life disease.
sentences.chinese: 這些小量接觸加在一起有可能導致日後產生疾病。

sentences.english: Clonal populations of transformed plants can then be produced by micropropagation.
sentences.chinese: 接着通過小量繁殖可以獲得轉化植株的克隆羣體。

sentences.english: Even small increases in activity improved the odds of staving off the disease.
sentences.chinese: 即使是小量增加活動也能改善削減癌症的機會。

sentences.english: When someone has a primary cancer tumor, a small number of cancer cells circulates through the bloodstream.
sentences.chinese: 當患者具有原發癌時，小量的癌細胞進入血流循環。

sentences.english: An ice chest with a small amount of ice performs this function well.
sentences.chinese: 一個冰櫃與小量的冰很好執行這個作用。

sentences.english: This procedure uses tiny electric shocks to permanently destroy the hair follicles.
sentences.chinese: 該方法通過小量輕微的點擊來永久性破壞毛囊。

sentences.english: The barman uses a small silver measure for brandy.
sentences.chinese: 酒吧服務員用銀質小量器量白蘭地酒。

sentences.english: When testing with a small Chinese character database, the result meets the requirement.
sentences.chinese: 在小量漢字字庫的測試中，該系統滿足設計需求。

definition: to consider/to allow for/to use one's discretion/to measure (food and drink)
to take medicine orally/oral (contraceptive etc)/to say that one is convinced
to take money or valuables out of storage/to recover/to ship goods/to extract (chemicals from solution)
albuterol, kind of chemical used in treating asthma
